dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3419 IH: Foreign Animal Disease Prevention, Surveillance, and Rapid Response Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Jackson of Texas (for himself, Ms. Craig, Mr. Bacon, Mr. Davis of North Carolina, and Mr. Costa) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Animal Health Protection Act to reauthorize the animal disease prevention and management programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Foreign Animal Disease Prevention, Surveillance, and Rapid Response Act of 2023.

section.header: Reauthorization of animal disease prevention and management programs

subsection.text: Section 10409A(d)(1) of the Animal Health Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 8308a(d)(1)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: Of the funds of the Commodity Credit Corporation, the Secretary shall make available to carry out this section $233,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2024 through 2028, of which—

clause.text: not less than $10,000,000 shall be made available for each such fiscal year to carry out subsection (a);
not less than $70,000,000 shall be made available for each such fiscal year to carry out subsection (b); and
not less than $153,000,000 shall be made available for each such fiscal year to carry out subsection (c).

subparagraph.text: Of the funds of the Commodity Credit Corporation, the Secretary shall make available to carry out this section $30,000,000 for fiscal year 2029 and each fiscal year thereafter, of which not less than $18,000,000 shall be made available for each of those fiscal years to carry out subsection (b).

paragraph.text: Section 10409A(d)(2)(A) of the Animal Health Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 8308a(d)(2)(A)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking 2019 through 2023 and inserting 2024 through 2028.

paragraph.header: National Animal Disease Preparedness and Response Program; National Animal Vaccine and Veterinary Countermeasures Bank
paragraph.text: Section 10409A(d)(2)(B) of the Animal Health Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 8308a(d)(2)(B)) is amended by striking 2019 through 2023 and inserting 2024 through 2028.

subsection.text: Section 10409A(e)(1) of the Animal Health Protection Act (7 U.S.C. 8308a(e)(1)) is amended by striking 2019 through 2023 and inserting 2024 through 2028.
